What Can Filecoin Do for AI?

TL;DR: Filecoin’s decentralized storage solutions are crucial for AI's future. It offers scalable storage, data integrity, and decentralization to solve AI’s biggest challenges

7/ Tools for AI & Data

Filecoin supports AI with tools like Water Lily, which compensates artists for their work, and 
@numbersprotocol
, which ensures the authenticity of content like photos. These tools ensure that AI and data storage are secure and fair.
Watch the full video:

Filecoin Quarterly Update: October 2024

TL;DR: Filecoin is decentralizing AI and advancing Web3. Key updates include faster storage with Fast Finality, AI projects using Filecoin, governance tools like Metropolis, and ecosystem growth with new teams building on the network.
Read the full article:

7/ The Importance of Data Preservation

A recent study revealed that the median lifespan of a website is just 2.3 years. Filecoin, along with 
@IPFS
, offers long-term storage that preserves our digital heritage in a world where web content vanishes fast.

Filecoin celebrates 4 years of Mainnet with major milestones

TL;DR: In the past year, Filecoin launched IPFS in space, secured Solana’s block history, introduced Fast Finality, and grew with AI integrations, L2 solutions, and FVM smart contracts.
Read the full article:

9/ Supporting Critical Datasets

Filecoin stores vital datasets, from the 
@CIA
 CREST database to human rights data. Democracy’s Library has uploaded over a petabyte of government data to the network, ensuring permanent public access.

In just 365 days, Filecoin has launched IPFS into space, stored Solana's full history onchain, rolled out L2s, and accelerated finality by 450x with F3. Thanks to the builders and storage providers making it all happen.

4/ Monitoring F3

Storage Providers can monitor F3 activity using Prometheus debug metrics, with specific logs to track key processes. Grafana templates will soon be available in the Lotus repo to make tracking F3 metrics even easier.

Conclusion

F3 reduces finality times and unlocks new use cases for 
@Filecoin
. SP participation is essential for making this upgrade a success, benefiting the entire network with quicker confirmations and enhanced performance.

Additional Resources:

FIP-0086: Fast Finality: https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/blob/master/FIPS/fip-0086.md…

How F3 is Transforming 
@Filecoin
:

F3 (Fast Finality) in Filecoin:

TL;DR: The Filecoin network is introducing F3 (Fast Finality) in version 24, reducing finality times from 7.5 hours to just minutes. This major upgrade will enhance transaction speed and user experience across the ecosystem.

3/ Implications for SPs

SPs play a key role in the upgraded consensus mechanism, contributing to faster finality and a more stable chain. Increased network activity comes with minimal overhead, and F3 works alongside Expected Consensus to maintain Filecoin’s robust security.

2/ Who Runs F3?

Storage Providers (SPs) with at least 10TiB raw power automatically participate in F3. While SPs manage the consensus, others like light clients, exchanges, and developers benefit from faster finality, creating more responsive applications.

1/ What is F3?

F3 cuts finality times from 7.5 hours to a few minutes, making transactions faster and more efficient. This improvement will greatly enhance user experience for builders, exchanges, and dApp users, ensuring quicker, more secure confirmations.

5/ Simulation Results

Simulations show that Pairwise Voting, even with reduced effort, aligns project rankings well with actual impact, outperforming global assessment methods.

7/ Conclusion

Pairwise Voting could improve decision-making in future 
@FILRetroPGF
 rounds by reducing badge holders' cognitive load and increasing the accuracy of capital allocation. Further refinement is needed to ensure fairness.
Watch the full video:

6/ Exploring Future Mechanisms

While Pairwise Voting is promising, the video discusses other mechanisms like quadratic voting and how badge holders’ votes should be aggregated fairly.

Voting Mechanism Design for Retro PGF: Improving Capital Allocation

TL;DR: Retro PGF seeks to allocate limited funds to impactful projects. The Pairwise Voting mechanism simplifies decision-making by focusing on smaller comparisons between projects.

4/ Scaling with the Bradley-Terry Model 

With 100 projects, the estimation model (like Bradley-Terry) uses partial data from comparisons to create reliable global rankings, making the process scalable.

3/ Introducing Pairwise Voting

Pairwise Voting presents badge holders with two projects at a time for comparison. This simplifies decision-making, leading to more informed outcomes with less cognitive load.

2/ Challenges with the Global Assessment Method

In the first iteration, badge holders had to evaluate all projects at once, leading to decision fatigue and suboptimal outcomes, especially with many projects under review.

1/ Introduction to Retro PGF:

The video explores a key challenge: how to allocate limited funds within the 
@FILRetroPGF
 framework, where badge holders decide which projects receive funding based on their impact.

Preparing Smart Contracts for Audits

TL;DR: Smart contract audits are crucial for securing Filecoin projects. Early security integration, proper documentation, and collaboration with auditors ensure fewer vulnerabilities and smoother processes.

4/ Post-audit, work with auditors to address issues. Submit fixes via pull requests for clear communication and review. Avoid unnecessary changes during the fix phase to prevent delays and ensure Filecoin contracts are secure.

5/ Integrating security early, using the right tools, and collaborating with auditors leads to safer Filecoin contracts. Each audit helps improve your security practices for future projects. 

Watch video:
3/ Plan ahead—reach out to auditors 3 months before code completion. Prepare threat models, documentation, and ensure internal reviews. The more thorough the prep, the fewer vulnerabilities found.

FIL-RetroPGF-2: Rewarding Impactful Contributions

TL;DR: FIL-RetroPGF-2 is a grant program recognizing Filecoin projects (April–Sept 2024). It includes four stages: project showcase, application intake, badgeholder evaluation, and funding distribution starting in December

4/ Why Participate?

This initiative offers financial backing, community engagement, and valuable feedback for your project. It’s a great opportunity to gain recognition for your work and help shape the future of the 
@Filecoin
 ecosystem.

Explore all links:

Notion: https://fil-retropgf.notion.site/Round-2-Timeline-103d0d646da180b2b7bcfb807032ae7c…

Security by Design for Smart Contracts

TL;DR: Integrate security early, use threat modeling, designate security champions, utilize security tools, and always have an emergency response plan in place.
5/ Have emergency response procedures in place for potential hacks or key losses. A prepared plan helps reduce damage during incidents.
Watch the full video:
4/ Use security checklists like SCVS and vulnerability aggregators to measure and improve smart contract security. Regular checks ensure best practices are followed.

Thread: Continuous Reliability Testing (CRT)
6/ CRT can feel like a superpower for development teams, ensuring bugs are caught in real time. With the right commitment, it transforms software development into a more efficient, confident process.
Watch the full video:

5/ Common mistakes in CRT adoption include giving up when facing too many legacy bugs, running tests too infrequently, and writing underpowered tests that miss complex issues. Success requires persistence and a commitment to continuous testing.

Thread: Filecoin’s Decentralized CDN & Retrieval Market

5/ How is Filecoin approaching this?

The Filecoin Retrieval Market is a modular initiative. The Retrieval Market Working Group (RMWG) is tackling challenges such as:

Ultra-fast payments
Enhanced data transfer protocols
Cryptoeconomic models for data retrieval

6/ Key Progress:

10 active grants
15 teams involved
160 million retrievals served per day
80 TB of bandwidth delivered daily

4/ Decentralized CDNs, like the one Filecoin is building, offer unique advantages:

Peer-to-peer (P2P) content sharing
Efficient delivery, especially in hard-to-reach areas
Nodes emerging in sparsely populated geographies

Filecoin Ecosystem Weekly Roundup 

Here’s a thread of the most important updates and developments from the Filecoin ecosystem this week. From partnerships to new innovations, let’s break down everything you need to know!

11/12

ZKproofs are changing the game for data storage & verification on Filecoin! 
With zk-SNARKs, Filecoin is now the largest zk-SNARK network, generating millions of proofs daily.

Learn more: https://x.com/LighthouseWeb3/status/1833525595789267098…

12/12

The vision for Filecoin is simple: verifiable, decentralized data storage that scales to meet humanity’s needs for centuries to come. 
Want to dive deeper? Check out the latest Filecoin Ecosystem Digest for all the details.

Read Digest: https://fil.org/digest/interplanetary-resilience…

10/12

Can blockchain improve African agriculture? 
Filecoin is helping tackle key farming challenges, from supply chain transparency to smart farming practices. Check out the Q&A with Allan Mang’eni, Orbit ambassador for Kenya.

Read more: https://fil.org/blog/harvesting-change-filecoin-s-role-in-addressing-agricultural-challenges-in-africa…

@filecoingreen
 that ensures environmental assets like carbon credits are stored with full transparency and verifiability. 

Learn how we're securing the future of green finance: https://co2.storage

FIL-RetroPGF-2 is Coming!
